title: passing reference to field of by-value struct causes ICE with mir-opt-level=3

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
fn do_nothing(_: &()) {}

pub struct Foo {
    bar: (),
}

pub fn by_value(foo: Foo) {
    do_nothing(&foo.bar);
}
```


```
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/monomorphize/collector.rs:1243: alloc id without corresponding allocation: 0

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:939:9

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.40.0-nightly (bc0e288ad 2019-11-11) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -Z mir-opt-level=3 -C opt-level=3 --crate-type lib
```
